intro: Galium tarokoense, commonly known as the Taroko bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pink flowers, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in the region.
